intro: Chrysopsis ballardii, commonly known as the Ballard's goldenweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is characterized by its yellow flowers and is often found in dry, rocky habitats. The plant belongs to the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and has small, narrow leaves that are arranged alternately along the stem. It is a perennial herb that typically grows to a height of about 10 to 30 centimeters. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
